author: My Storm Heroes
title: Tired of dealing with insurance? Let My Storm Heroes rescue your home from storm damage | Paid Content | weareiowa.com
text: [Storm Heroes](https://mystormheroes.com/) is a 2 person team of Storm Damage experts with a combined 15 years of experience identifying storm damage, and helping their customers navigate confusing property insurance claims. A few key things they would like to help people understand are: how to identify signs that you may need to call someone to inspect your home for damage, and the importance of finding a contractor that you trust that has experience working with storm damage claims to team up with your insurance company to help make sure you get fully indemnified and your property restored. Storm damage can be difficult to identify if it is not something you are used to looking for. Many homeowners have no idea they have damage at all. Just a few simple signs you can look for after a storm comes through your area are: a lot of leaves or branches on the ground, knocked out of trees by wind or hail, dents on the metals of your home that you can see from ground level, holes in your vinyl siding, or the "cleaned off" white marks called spatter, on your sidewalk or deck. If you see these or anything else that see that seems suspicious, you should call your trusted storm damage contractor. Storm Heroes will provide a comprehensive analysis of your property for absolutely free. Your storm damage contractor will fully inspect your property to insure all damage is identified, and help the adjuster find it all during the adjuster inspection as well. They will work hard to provide all the evidence necessary, during each step of the process, and help overcome the obstacles that will surely come during a property claim. A few things you should look for when choosing a storm damage contractor to work with are: - Knowledge and experience specific to the storm damage industry and dealing with insurance claims. This is a very confusing, ever-changing industry that requires constantly being up to date on best practices. - Do you trust them and feel they are working with integrity and your best interests in mind and will they help you with every aspect of your claim for your benefit? - Will they be there helping you throughout the entirety of your claim until the end, and will they be around in case you need them in the future? - Do they have some references of the quality of service they provide that they are willing to share with you? Contact Storm Heroes now for a trustworthy, committed team ready to help with your storm damage claim.
